p: Due to an additional supplementation with lysine and methionine of 0.1% (1 g/kg) in all three experimental diets ( Table 1), respectively, no definite conclusion on the impact of the differing amino acid compositions on growth performance of quail chicks can be drawn. However, since the lysine and methionine requirements of Japanese quail chicks are 1.3% and 0.5% [ 28], respectively, these are significantly higher than the 0.1% supplied by the vit & min premix (see Table 1), and the protein source has been determined to have an impact.
